article.title: General Dynamics Wins Army Consolidated Product Line Mangement Contract
article.author: Henry Kenyon
article.text: The U.S. Army has awarded General Dynamics a five-year contract valued up to $200 million for the Consolidated Product-line Management program. The contract will improve the Army's ability to consolidate and efficiently manage the diverse elements of its live combat training system product lines and streamline the process for rapidly adapting systems and equipment to changing missions and threats.
